title: crypto_jhon
author: crypto_jhon
content: I have been scouring the Internet for a very long time in search of other income besides cryptocurrency, I like to learn something new. And you know what I found, I think it's no secret that exchangers like to entice new customers with various gifts or bonuses. Here I found such an exchange in Google. I read a little bit about it, logged in, got 100USDT to my account. But that's not all, I could not withdraw, asked to replenish the account. I couldn't withdraw all these sums and I was asked to deposit some money to my account. Being on their exchanger, found some good stuff, and invested $1000, I will be withdrawing in a week. Should have accumulated passive 1200-1400$

I read a little bit about it, logged in, got 100USDT to my account. But that's not all, I could not withdraw, asked to replenish the account. I couldn't withdraw all these sums and I was asked to deposit some money to my account. Being on their exchanger, found some good stuff, and invested $1000, I will be withdrawing in a week. Should have accumulated passive 1200-1400$  This link https://goo.su/UBxzKFd

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: I see two possibilities here. the first is that you are so naive and believed in an obvious fraud, where someone gives you money as a gift, but first, you have to make a deposit 10x larger to cash in on that gift. you are also talking about some great earnings in a very short period of time.Another possibility is that you are the owner or an accomplice in this fraud and in this way you are trying to lure new victims. This scenario seems much more likely to me. I visited the site you are promoting here, which is bitlems.com. the domain was registered less than 20 days ago and already offers a profit of 10% per week and up to 250% per 3 months period. I really don't know what kind of idiot someone has to be to believe this.Code:Domain Name: BITLEMS.COMRegistry Domain ID: 2759536047_DOMAIN_COM-VRSNRegistrar WHOIS Server: whois.nicenic.netRegistrar URL: http://www.nicenic.netUpdated Date: 2023-02-19T10:28:55ZCreation Date: 2023-02-19T10:20:48ZRegistry Expiry Date: 2024-02-19T10:20:48Zwhen I look at the history of your posts here, maybe this is your new account on the forum, but you are definitely not a complete beginner in crypto things. You also offer some great profit through your Telegram group. I'm pretty sure you're deliberately trying to trick people here, rather than you are just naive.

comments.author: jayce
comments.created_time: March 06, 2023, 12:28:10 PMLast edit: May 17, 2023, 06:31:05 PM by jayce
comments.body: I visited the website and in the first sight, I was quite amazed on its design. But then I did realize that they use 45° rotated old WAVES[1] logo as theirs and there are no social urls such twitter or medium, to see if the project is legit or not. It's indeed fishy especially when this project gives away 100USDT for the new users. In this case, I agree with examplens.[1] [img height=30]https://talkimg.com/images/2023/05/17/blob03135b73be42ea6d.png[/img]

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: crypto_jhon on March 05, 2023, 09:06:36 PMI have been scouring the Internet for a very long time in search of other income besides cryptocurrency, I like to learn something new. And you know what I found, I think it's no secret that exchangers like to entice new customers with various gifts or bonuses. Here I found such an exchange in Google. I read a little bit about it, logged in, got 100USDT to my account. But that's not all, I could not withdraw, asked to replenish the account. I couldn't withdraw all these sums and I was asked to deposit some money to my account. Being on their exchanger, found some good stuff, and invested $1000, I will be withdrawing in a week. Should have accumulated passive 1200-1400$  Have you invested $1,000 in the bitlems.com exchange? Were you able to withdraw your bonus after a week has passed, as you mentioned? It's been over a week since you created this thread and we haven't seen you again, man, most of the new scam exchanges do these offers just to lure clients to make a deposit on their scam platform, I don't think you could withdraw from their platform because there are no reviews about it on any of the review sites or in the blogs, I think that this exchange platform appeared to you in an advertisement in Google, Did you do your own research? I've seen a lot of negative highlights about this Bitlems exchange, Check out the following screenshot:

comments.author: btc_angela
comments.body: Quote from: crypto_jhon on March 05, 2023, 09:06:36 PMI have been scouring the Internet for a very long time in search of other income besides cryptocurrency, I like to learn something new. And you know what I found, I think it's no secret that exchangers like to entice new customers with various gifts or bonuses. Here I found such an exchange in Google. I read a little bit about it, logged in, got 100USDT to my account. But that's not all, I could not withdraw, asked to replenish the account. I couldn't withdraw all these sums and I was asked to deposit some money to my account. Being on their exchanger, found some good stuff, and invested $1000, I will be withdrawing in a week. Should have accumulated passive 1200-1400$  As the saying goes, "if it's too good to be true, probably is".And if you are saying that you can't withdraw and ask you to deposit more, then it's a sign that this is a scam.Anyhow, good luck to you and your $1000 invested, hopefully you will get that supposedly accumulate passive, if not, then it's gonna be too late because you are not going to get that money back for sure.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: Op you either the website owner try to attract more people or just really a newbie the website is clearly a scam, In my opinion, the other guys above me already said a lot of it. and if you really deposited 1000$ you better withdraw while still can or your money will *Puff* Gone if you like Centralized Exchange top of exchange maybe top 10 or most exchange has a reward for a new user it is to gain more user and yes sometimes you need to do some sort of task before can withdraw but not deposit. I know an exchange that gives 50$-100$ to test out and the profit can be withdrawn.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: examplens on March 06, 2023, 11:15:04 AMI see two possibilities here. the first is that you are so naive and believed in an obvious fraud, where someone gives you money as a gift, but first, you have to make a deposit 10x larger to cash in on that gift. you are also talking about some great earnings in a very short period of time.Another possibility is that you are the owner or an accomplice in this fraud and in this way you are trying to lure new victims. This scenario seems much more likely to me. I visited the site you are promoting here, which is bitlems.com. the domain was registered less than 20 days ago and already offers a profit of 10% per week and up to 250% per 3 months period. I really don't know what kind of idiot someone has to be to believe this.Code:Domain Name: BITLEMS.COMRegistry Domain ID: 2759536047_DOMAIN_COM-VRSNRegistrar WHOIS Server: whois.nicenic.netRegistrar URL: http://www.nicenic.netUpdated Date: 2023-02-19T10:28:55ZCreation Date: 2023-02-19T10:20:48ZRegistry Expiry Date: 2024-02-19T10:20:48Zwhen I look at the history of your posts here, maybe this is your new account on the forum, but you are definitely not a complete beginner in crypto things. You also offer some great profit through your Telegram group. I'm pretty sure you're deliberately trying to trick people here, rather than you are just naive.It is more like that this is not naivety or idiocy, but selfish interest. This person posts a suspicious story 3 weeks after creating an account and I would not even dare to click on his link. This whole fake legend smells from the very beginning.There is clearly a 2nd scenario here. Sites that offer super profits should be avoided. This is a fake bait. Even more so, go around a mile when they ask you to replenish a deposit in order to withdraw a bonus. This is a classic scam.The verdict for beginners is simple: don't fall for this folly.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: Quote from: crypto_jhon on March 05, 2023, 09:36:56 PMQuote from: crypto_jhon on March 05, 2023, 09:06:36 PMI have been scouring the Internet for a very long time in search of other income besides cryptocurrency, I like to learn something new. And you know what I found, I think it's no secret that exchangers like to entice new customers with various gifts or bonuses. Here I found such an exchange in Google. I read a little bit about it, logged in, got 100USDT to my account. But that's not all, I could not withdraw, asked to replenish the account. I couldn't withdraw all these sums and I was asked to deposit some money to my account. Being on their exchanger, found some good stuff, and invested $1000, I will be withdrawing in a week. Should have accumulated passive 1200-1400$  This link https://goo.su/UBxzKFdYou cannot withdraw and yet you are promoting it you even use a link cloaker which is a violation of the forum rule your link leads me here Code:https://bitlems.com/signup?promo=wYzzrOG0DP  of course the wYzzrOG0DP is your referral link.I'm 100% sure that this is a scam exchange because the scheme of asking deposit for you to withdraw has been proven to be a bait or trap for you to deposit but in the end, they will not send you your cashout, this is an old scam and you do not know it because you are a newbie.I did not open the site because my AV is blocking it seems there are already reports on this platform.

comments.author: savetheFORUM
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on March 17, 2023, 10:02:41 PMYou cannot withdraw and yet you are promoting it you even use a link cloaker which is a violation of the forum rule your link leads me here Code:https://bitlems.com/signup?promo=wYzzrOG0DP  of course the wYzzrOG0DP is your referral link.I'm 100% sure that this is a scam exchange because the scheme of asking deposit for you to withdraw has been proven to be a bait or trap for you to deposit but in the end, they will not send you your cashout, this is an old scam and you do not know it because you are a newbie.I did not open the site because my AV is blocking it seems there are already reports on this platform.It is not actually an exchange, but it is more like a HYIP (High Yield Investment Program) that lures new users by showing great returns on investments and scam them. If you open the home page and scroll down, you will see a profit calculator which tells you that you can earn 70% profit in only a month for your investment, so if you invest $1000, you will get $700 profit in a month.That is too good to be true and anyone with sanity should understand that it cannot be true and they will never pay any of that but it is just to show and attract new users to make deposits.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: With that kind of story, I have that quick coming up that type of exchange is a scam. No exchange will give you $100 for free and then will ask you to deposit because that's the actual there. And it has happened for so many times when newbies have asked in the past how they're going to get that free money. But the reality, is that they won't get it. Once you deposit on that exchange, they'll have another questionable requirement to you and might ask for another deposit. It's a loop that you'll never like unless you're the owner of this website and you're shilling it here. And with the whois information given, this is the type of exchanges or websites that I mostly avoid.

Should have accumulated passive 1200-1400$  This link https://goo.su/UBxzKFdOf course, there are many income generating jobs on the internet, but they all require knowledge and effort, nothing is free. I want to tell you that nothing is free, things that fall from the sky, if anything, are just rainwater and bird droppings, and they are entirely useless. I don't know about the website you are referring to and don't want to click on it to find out but beware of all that, what you want from them is money, and what they want from you is money too. So beware of temptations.
